present participle of
burrow
[ I usually + adv/prep ] to dig a hole in the ground, especially to live in: Rats had burrowed into the bank of the river.
[ T + adv/prep ] to move yourself into a position where you can feel warm, comfortable, or safe: Suddenly shy, our young daughter burrowed her head into my shoulder.
[ I + adv/prep ] to search for something, as if by digging: I burrowed through the clothes in the drawer looking for a clean pair of socks.
